line: Turning and turning in the widening gyre,
annotation: The gyre describes the spiral flight pattern of the falcon. As it circles ever wider, it loses sight and hearing of the falconer. The widening gyre, then, is a loss of control and an inevitable entropy.

line: The falcon cannot hear the falconer;
Things fall apart; the centre cannot hold;
annotation: Like many lines in this poem, "things fall apart" has taken on a life of its own. It is perhaps most recognizable as the title of Chinua Achebe's novel about Nigerian response to colonization.
